target_paper.title: Cantera et al. 2016
target_paper.objective_summary: The main research objective of Cantera et al. (2016) is to investigate the impact of high copper concentrations and enhanced methane transfer on microbial communities during enrichment, focusing on their role in methane biodegradation. The study employs an experimental approach using enrichment cultivation conditions to develop microbial communities with high efficiency and robustness in methane abatement.

comparisons.reasoning:

differences:

2. methods: paper a employs an experimental approach using enrichment cultivation conditions, while paper b involves enriching a methanotrophic consortium from anaerobic digester effluent under high h2s stress and studying the effects of various factors on cell cultivation and conversion.

in conclusion, while both papers share similarities in their focus on manipulating microbial communities for methane-related processes, their specific objectives, methods, and claims differ, resulting in a medium level of similarity.
